intro: Xylopia odoratissima var. minor, commonly known as the lesser fragrant xylopia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer months. The plant produces a fruit that is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and medicinal studies.
